intro: Wulffia blanchetii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along riverbanks. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, greenish fruits that contain several seeds. Wulffia blanchetii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
